TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit GeoCoordinate extends System.Object implements class System.IEquatable`1<class System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate>

Docs.summary: Represents a geographical location that is determined by latitude and longitude coordinates. May also include altitude, accuracy, speed, and course information.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of that has no data fields set.

remarks.format:
## Remarks All data fields are set to <xref:System.Double.NaN>. The new instance of <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate> is equivalent to <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate.Unknown>.
This constructor should be used for serialization.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(float64 latitude, float64 longitude) cil managed

Docs.param: The latitude of the location. May range from -90.0 to 90.0.
The longitude of the location. May range from -180.0 to 180.0.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class from latitude and longitude data.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The latitude and longitude values must correspond to an actual location on the globe.

Docs.exception: Latitude or longitude is out of range.

MemberSignature.Value: public GeoCoordinate (double latitude, double longitude, double altitude);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(float64 latitude, float64 longitude, float64 altitude) cil managed

Docs.param: The altitude in meters. May be negative, 0, positive, or <xref:System.Double>, if unknown.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class from latitude, longitude, and altitude data.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The latitude and longitude values must correspond to an actual location on the globe.

MemberSignature.Value: public GeoCoordinate (double latitude, double longitude, double altitude, double horizontalAccuracy, double verticalAccuracy, double speed, double course);

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(float64 latitude, float64 longitude, float64 altitude, float64 horizontalAccuracy, float64 verticalAccuracy, float64 speed, float64 course) cil managed

Docs.param: The latitude of the location. May range from -90.0 to 90.0.
The longitude of the location. May range from -180.0 to 180.0.
The altitude in meters. May be negative, 0, positive, or <xref:System.Double>, if unknown.

The accuracy of the latitude and longitude coordinates, in meters. Must be greater than or equal to 0. If a value of 0 is supplied to this constructor, the <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate.HorizontalAccuracy%2A> property will be set to <xref:System.Double.NaN>.

The accuracy of the altitude, in meters. Must be greater than or equal to 0. If a value of 0 is supplied to this constructor, the <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate.VerticalAccuracy%2A> property will be set to <xref:System.Double.NaN>.
The speed measured in meters per second. May be negative, 0, positive, or <xref:System.Double>, if unknown. A negative speed can indicate moving in reverse.
The direction of travel, rather than orientation. This parameter is measured in degrees relative to true north. Must range from 0 to 360.0, or be <xref:System.Double>.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class from latitude, longitude, altitude, horizontal accuracy, vertical accuracy, speed, and course.
Gets the altitude of the , in meters.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The altitude is given relative to sea level.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the heading in degrees, relative to true north.
Docs.value: The heading in degrees, relative to true north.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The valid range includes values from 0.0 to 360.0, and `Double.NaN` if the heading is not defined.
## Examples The following example prints the Course and <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate.Speed%2A> properties of the current location's <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate>.
[!code-cs[System.Device.Location.CourseAndSpeed#2](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/courseandspeed/courseandspeed.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Device.Location.CourseAndSpeed#2](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/courseandspeed/courseandspeed.vb#2)]

Docs.exception: Course is set outside the valid range.
Docs.returns: The heading in degrees, relative to true north.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool Equals(class System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate other) cil managed

Docs.param: The object to compare to the calling object.
Docs.summary: Determines if the object is equivalent to the parameter, based solely on latitude and longitude.
Docs.returns: if the objects are equal; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Equivalent <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate> objects have the same <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate.Latitude%2A> and <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate.Longitude%2A> properties. The <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate.Altitude%2A>, <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate.HorizontalAccuracy%2A>, and <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate.VerticalAccuracy%2A> properties are not used to determine equivalency.

Docs.value: if the objects are equal; otherwise, .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance bool Equals(object obj) cil managed

Docs.param: The object to compare the to.
Docs.summary: Determines if a specified is equal to the current , based solely on latitude and longitude.
Docs.returns: , if the objects are equal; otherwise,.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Equivalent <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate> objects have the same <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate.Latitude%2A> and <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate.Longitude%2A> properties. The <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate.Altitude%2A>, <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate.HorizontalAccuracy%2A>, and <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate.VerticalAccuracy%2A> properties are not used to determine equivalency.

Docs.value: , if the objects are equal; otherwise,.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance float64 GetDistanceTo(class System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate other) cil managed

Docs.param: The for the location to calculate the distance to.
Docs.summary: Returns the distance between the latitude and longitude coordinates that are specified by this and another specified .
Docs.returns: The distance between the two coordinates, in meters.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The Haversine formula is used to calculate the distance. The Haversine formula accounts for the curvature of the earth, but assumes a spherical earth rather than an ellipsoid. For long distances, the Haversine formula introduces an error of less than 0.1 percent.
Altitude is not used to calculate the distance.

Docs.value: The distance between the two coordinates, in meters.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance int32 GetHashCode() cil managed

Docs.summary: Serves as a hash function for the .
Docs.returns: A hash code for the current .

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate> objects that are equivalent have the same hash code. Equivalent <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate> objects have the same <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate.Latitude%2A> and <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate.Longitude%2A> properties. The <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate.Altitude%2A>, <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate.HorizontalAccuracy%2A>, and <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate.VerticalAccuracy%2A> properties are not used to determine equivalency.

Docs.value: A hash code for the current .

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the accuracy of the latitude and longitude that is given by the , in meters.
Docs.value: The accuracy of the latitude and longitude, in meters.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The accuracy can be considered the radius of certainty of the latitude and longitude data. A circular area that is formed with the accuracy as the radius and the latitude and longitude coordinates as the center contains the actual location.

Docs.exception: HorizontalAccuracy is set outside the valid range.
Docs.returns: The accuracy of the latitude and longitude, in meters.

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the does not contain latitude or longitude data.
Docs.value: if the does not contain latitude or longitude data; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks A <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate> that does not contain latitude or longitude data is equal to <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate.Unknown>.
## Examples The following code example verifies whether the <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate> that corresponds to a location is <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate.Unknown> before printing out its latitude and longitude.
[!code-cs[System.Device.Location.GetLocationDataSyncHandleUnknown#1](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/getlocationdatasynchandleunknown/getlocationdatasynchandleunknown.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Device.Location.GetLocationDataSyncHandleUnknown#1](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/System.Device.Location.GetLocationDataSyncHandleUnknown/GetLocationDataSyncHandleUnknown.vb#1)]

Docs.returns: if the does not contain latitude or longitude data; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the latitude of the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Latitude can range from -90.0 to 90.0. Latitude is measured in degrees north or south from the equator. Positive values are north of the equator and negative values are south of the equator.
## Examples The following example prints the latitude and longitude values that are obtained from a <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate>.
[!code-vb[System.Device.Location.LocationEvent1#1](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/locationevent/locationevent.vb#1)] [!code-cs[System.Device.Location.LocationEvent1#1](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/locationevent/locationevent.cs#1)]

Docs.exception: Latitude is set outside the valid range.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the longitude of the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The longitude can range from -180.0 to 180.0. Longitude is measured in degrees east or west of the prime meridian. Negative values are west of the prime meridian, and positive values are east of the prime meridian.
## Examples The following example prints the latitude and longitude values that are obtained from a <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate>.
[!code-vb[System.Device.Location.LocationEvent1#1](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/locationevent/locationevent.vb#1)] [!code-cs[System.Device.Location.LocationEvent1#1](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/locationevent/locationevent.cs#1)]

Docs.exception: Longitude is set outside the valid range.

The <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate.Altitude%2A>, <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate.HorizontalAccuracy%2A>, and <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate.VerticalAccuracy%2A> properties are not used to determine equivalency.

Docs.value: , if the objects are determined to be equivalent; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Equivalent <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate> objects have the same <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate.Latitude%2A> and <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate.Longitude%2A> properties. The <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate.Altitude%2A>, <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate.HorizontalAccuracy%2A>, and <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate.VerticalAccuracy%2A> properties are not used to determine equivalency.

Docs.value: , if the objects are determined to be different; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the speed in meters per second.
Docs.value: The speed in meters per second. The speed must be greater than or equal to zero, or <xref:System.Double>.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example prints the <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate.Course%2A> and Speed properties of the current location's <xref:System.Device.Location.GeoCoordinate>.
[!code-cs[System.Device.Location.CourseAndSpeed#2](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/courseandspeed/courseandspeed.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Device.Location.CourseAndSpeed#2](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/courseandspeed/courseandspeed.vb#2)]

Docs.exception: Speed is set outside the valid range.
Docs.returns: The speed in meters per second. The speed must be greater than or equal to zero, or <xref:System.Double>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance string ToString() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a string that contains the latitude and longitude.
Docs.returns: A string that contains the latitude and longitude, separated by a comma.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The string representation returned by this method is intended only for debugging use. This method does not return any locale-specific formatting for latitude and longitude.

Docs.value: A string that contains the latitude and longitude, separated by a comma.

Docs.summary: Represents a object that has unknown latitude and longitude fields.
